item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, May 19, 2025 at 6:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The Windows Subsystem for Linux is now open source (380 points | 207 comments)
2. Zod 4 (331 points | 121 comments)
3. Show HN: Windows 98 themed website in 1 HTML file for my post punk band (20 points | 2 comments)
4. Launch HN: Better Auth (YC X25) – Authentication Framework for TypeScript (117 points | 41 comments)
5. Too Much Go Misdirection (78 points | 23 comments)
6. European Investment Bank to inject €70B in European tech (119 points | 105 comments)
7. Wikipedia's Most Translated Articles (42 points | 19 comments)
8. ClawPDF – Open-Source Virtual/Network PDF Printer with OCR and Image Support (132 points | 18 comments)
9. Glasskube (YC S24) is hiring in Vienna to build Open Source deployment tools ( | hide)
10. Remarks on AI from NZ (31 points | 8 comments)
11. Kelp – simple replacement for homebrew on macOS (41 points | 12 comments)
12. Rivers (6 points | discuss)
13. InventWood is about to mass-produce wood that's stronger than steel (377 points | 355 comments)
14. Game theory illustrated by an animated cartoon game (22 points | 2 comments)
15. Claude Code SDK – Anthropic (7 points | 1 comment)
16. Telum II at Hot Chips 2024: Mainframe with a Unique Caching Strategy (101 points | 41 comments)
17. GitHub Copilot Coding Agent (120 points | 63 comments)
18. Side projects I've built since 2009 (193 points | 110 comments)
19. 23andMe Sells Gene-Testing Business to DNA Drug Maker Regeneron (108 points | 63 comments)
20. Diffusion Models Explained Simply (64 points | 9 comments)
21. Edit is now open source (51 points | 8 comments)
22. Visualizing 100k Years of Earth in WebGL (28 points | 9 comments)
23. SDB Scans the Ruby Stack Without the GVL (26 points | 4 comments)
24. Dilbert Creator Scott Adams Says He Will Die Soon from Same Cancer as Joe Biden (55 points | 29 comments)
25. Show HN: Cogitator – A Python Toolkit for Chain-of-Thought Prompting (41 points | 6 comments)
26. About Asteroids, Atari's biggest arcade hit (38 points | 36 comments)
27. “There are people who can see and others who cannot even look” (235 points | 72 comments)
28. Show HN: Goboscript, text-based programming language, compiles to Scratch (145 points | 54 comments)
29. In Memoriam: John L. Young, Cryptome Co-Founder (221 points | 27 comments)
30. Microsoft's ICC blockade: digital dependence comes at a cost (8 points | discuss)
